tool_calls.input_summary: {"title": "MVP Prep: expand test suite as pre-release quality gate", "body": "Substantial expansion of the test suite to serve as the definitive quality gate before sharing the blueprint with the Lean...

input_full.title: MVP Prep: expand test suite as pre-release quality gate
input_full.body:
Substantial expansion of the test suite to serve as the definitive quality gate before sharing the blueprint with the Lean community.

## Stakes

This test suite will be the last line of defense before public release. The pass threshold is 100% at all tiers -- no exceptions, no skips. Once the suite passes, the blueprint should be indistinguishable from a polished, bug-free, well-crafted tool. MVP scope does not mean MVP quality. We are not shipping "good enough" -- we are shipping something that Terence Tao could use without finding something embarrassing to file an issue about.

The test suite must function as a **perfect filter**: if it passes 100%, there is nothing about the Side-by-Side Blueprint that deviates from the standard we've set.

## Phased Rollout

1. **Phase 1 - SBS-Test:** All new tests target SBS-Test only. Iterate until 100% pass rate across all tiers (evergreen, dev, temporary).
2. **Phase 2 - GCR & PNT:** Once SBS-Test hits 100%, run the full suite against GCR and PNT. These should already pass given current stability, but we verify before sharing. No assumptions.

Tests must be written so project scope is configurable -- not hardcoded to exclude GCR/PNT, just phased in execution order.

## Scope

- **Audit existing tests** against freshly updated MVP.md: identify gaps, contradictions, and tests covering non-MVP concerns
- **Add comprehensive new tests** covering all MVP dimensions, including hard-to-capture qualities (e.g., "a tool that is a pleasure to use", visual polish, discoverability, professional feel)
- **Go overboard** -- err on the side of too many tests, prune via multiple user dialogues about what should and should not be included
- **Iterate aggressively** -- expect many rounds of writing, running, adjusting until the suite is both comprehensive and passing

## Process

- Read current MVP.md as source of truth
- Catalog existing tests against MVP requirements
- Propose new tests in batches with user review
- Multiple dialogues to determine inclusion/exclusion boundaries
- Run, fail, fix, repeat until 100%

---
Created with [Claude Code](https://claude.ai/code)
